content.description: Fantastic slippery offwidth crack. Classic Rock Canyon sandbag. Bring the big cams and an appetite for grunting.
content.protection: Medium to large cams with chain anchors.
content.location: Climbs the obvious wide crack 5 feet left of Spam. Lower or rappel off the chains.

content.description: The pump builds as you pinch and jug up to an enigmatic crux.
content.location: Shares anchors with Slim Jim. These are the only bolted routes on the Meat Wall. This is the right line.

content.description: On the far left side (uphill) of the wall, you can see this nice short handcrack with a wide pod halfway up. Well worth the time. Fun!
content.protection: Takes 1-2" gear for al but the pod and the very end of the crack. Bolt anchor on top.

content.description:
A short, quite burly route on slippery, polished quartzite that trends right when the holds and rock say go left.

Start using some stemming and liebacking to get to the first bolt, and then make careful use of what feet there are while using reasonably good handholds to the second bolt. After the second bolt bear right on poorer feet while looking in vain for truly positive handholds.

After the third bolt lies the crux: getting up and over the top with slopey handholds and poor feet.
content.location:
The left-most of two bolted routes on the

Meat Wall

.

content.description: Start off the route with excellent finger locks, placing bomber nuts. Off hand jam and lieback up and out a slippery bulge (crux) to easier terrain.
content.protection: #4 & #7 DMM Wallnut; .75, 1, & 2 BD Camalot; #3 Mastercam. Chain anchor.
content.location: This route is located to the right of Spam (easily located by the fixed piton and head 15-20 feet up) and to the left of Meat By-Product. It is route #5 in the beta photo. It climbs a shallow left facing dihedral.

content.description: Very powerful route with straightforward gear. A nasty fingerlock is the key to redpointing this steep line.
content.protection: Medium to large nuts and cams. There is also a bomber fixed nut and a pin that flexes if you fall on it. Recommend backing up the pin with a micro nut.
content.location: Steepest least featured route right in the middle of the wall. Climb face holds about 5 feet left of Piece of Meat. Lower off the chains.

content.description:
P1

. Easy climbing up ledges and along a crack system to a ledge with a bolted anchor. There are good gear placements all the way up and you can find a spot for just about anything.

P2

. Haven't done it yet. It can probably be combined with P1 although rope drag might get to be annoying towards the top.

The belay position is slightly awkward on a slippery slope, from which you really wouldn't want to slide off. We built an anchor upslope a bit and used a long tie-in with the rope.
content.protection: Medium and large nuts and/or small to medium cams, a hangers-and-rings anchor at the top of P1. Just about anything else will also fit somewhere on this route (I placed a bomber #5 camalot just because I could).
content.location:
The route, as the name implies, is the corner at the right of the

Meat Wall

. Start near where you reach the top of the ledge system when scrambling to the wall and traverse a few feet right to the first placements. You can lower from the bolted anchors or continue up P2 and walk off.

content.description: Not as bad as you might think. I remember that we scoped it out from the ground for a while before getting onto it. The transition into the left crack was a bit tricky but I never thought, "Man, that's tough."
content.location:
On the right side of

The Meat Wall

and starts to the left of the big, obvious wide crack. Head up the right crack and switch into the left one higher up.

content.description:
A fun, mellow route with plenty of good pro available.

The Cleaver

follows a wide crack to the top of

Meat Wall

.

The first bit is the more difficult but good hand jams and numerous jugs abound. After the first twenty-five feet or so the climbing gets considerably easier, but is pleasantly airy. Save gear for an anchor at the top. Top out and walk off southwest to the talus field to the west.
content.protection: Medium to large nuts and small to large cams. I used a #4 BD C4 and a #4 Friend and there are spots where both a #5 and a #6 BD C4 would fit if you wanted.
content.location:
On the right side of

Meat Wall

is an obvious wide crack that extends up the full height of the wall. The crack is located just before the east-facing bit of wall that bounds the main part of

Meat Wall

.
